author: Somesh Jha
text:
Passengers can opt out of meals offered on three trains

The Railway Ministry will soon do away with one pantry car in eight Rajdhani trains that have two pantry cars, and will eventually offer passengers an option to opt out of the meals provided on board the Shatabdi, Rajdhani and Duronto trains.

At present, pantry car services are available on all 21 pairs of Rajdhani trains. “The second pantry car comes at the cost of one passenger coach and loss of revenue to the Railways. We will earn around Rs. 10 crore on each train by adding a passenger coach,” said a Railway Ministry official, on condition of anonymity.

The Rajdhani trains that will only have one pantry car instead of two will be: August Kranti Rajdhani (H. Nizamuddin-Mumbai Central), Mumbai Rajdhani, Patna Rajdhani, Ahmedabad Rajdhani, Howrah Rajdhani, Sealdah Rajdhani, Guwahati Rajdhani and Dibrugarh Rajdhani.

Also, passengers will have a choice to opt out of the meals provided to them on board the Shatabdi, Rajdhani and Duronto trains at the time of booking the tickets.

title: Railways to drop second pantry car on shorter routes
